history.content:
I went to www.berkeley.edu and in the search field typed "change grade" and the first relevant link (just the sixth from the top) read "

eGrades: Correcting Mistakes or Changing Grades

That link gives instructions for faculty to correct their mistake.  Please share the link with the instructor who is indeed able to fix this without involving "department administration" at all:  https://orapps.berkeley.edu/Registrar/egrade_correction.html

children.subject:
I am so sorry.  Send me a direct email to sasson@berkeley.edu off-piazza and we'll get to the bottom of this and make sure you get credit.

Please share with me your SID, the confirmation email from the summer instructor and the name of the faculty member you've been communicating with for fall.
I sent the email, thanks again!

Hi Mr. Sasson, thanks for getting back to me. I emailed the professor but this was his response today:

"I am so sorry but I have not made a clerical error.  My "marching orders" are clear.   When grading, any student who appears on the class list and has not completed the work is to be assigned a failing grade by the instructor.  If a student feels that he or she has appeared on that list erroneously, then I am afraid that he or she needs to resolve that with the department or university administration.  I  hope you understand that I cannot change the NP to P under these circumstances.  As I said in my previous email, you need to have this corrected by the administration.  Best of luck in resolving this, and sorry that this is not within my control."

The problem is that the CS 375 instructor for the summer somehow left out my name in the list of people who should have passed. (I emailed him about it and he confirmed I was supposed to pass. He said he couldn't do anything about it and told me to contact the fall instructor.) 

So now the fall professor is telling me HE can't do anything about it. 

I'm feeling really helpless and frustrated at a mistake I had no part in. Who do I talk to now?

history.content: I accidentally received a NP for CS375 this past semester and the professor just got back to me today. He apologized and said that I have to follow up with the "department administration." Does anyone know who I should contact, and if so, what their email address is?
history.subject: Who to contact for changing Fall 16 grade?

history.content: I accidentally received a NP for 375 this past semester and the professor just got back to me today. He apologized and said that I have to follow up with the "department administration." Does anyone know who I should contact, and if so, what their email address is?
